title: Shambles of a GP Surgery
body: Very unprofessional receptionists, Doctors and nurses are ill equipped, Instead of helping you they go against you. And they palm you off to a email box that's probably never gets read. been waiting 2 and 1/2 years to get one condition sorted out! AVOID at all costs.

title: Inefficient
body: Waited in queue of 8 to speak with receptionist only to be told to ring back tomorrow!  Waste of receptionist's time and my own but at least receptionist is getting paid by taxpayer (myself) for her time! How can this be an efficient way to run a surgery?

title: Great Service and Friendly Staff
body: I've been registered with this practice for over 6 years and I have only had good experiences. The staff are friendly and helpful, I've never had problems with the waiting times and the doctors are great. Compared to other medical practices I've been with, Clerkenwell is by far the best!

title: Efficient
body:
Discovered what  i suspected of being skin cancer , booked a appointment on NHS app, and got to see doctor within 48hrs.

Excellent

title: Doctor did not phone me back
body: I rang the surgery this morning and was told that the doctor would call me this afternoon from 2pm to 4:30pm, it is now 5:55pm  and no phone call. I am in a lot of pain and will have to go to the hospital. This surgery should be closed down, sooner than later

title: Disappointing Service
body: To get an appointment, you need to ring at 8:15, but when doing so I have had to ring around 20 times each time before someone picks up. I understand this practice may be overrun, but I still feel that my needs have been neglected. When phoning up a few weeks ago for an appointment with my doctor, I was only allowed to speak to a clinician who said they would refer me to the mental health team, yet I never heard anything. It took an a&e trip to get any form of service, and even after that and after explaining that counselling would be beneficial, I was referred to the wrong place (a crisis line) when i was told it would be counselling. When attempting to get my medication in the past, I was not allowed to go through the NHS app when ordering my prescription, yet when ringing I was interrupted many times by the reception team as they told me to order my prescription online even though I could not do so because I have to speak to a doctor first every time. It has led to me being without my medication for over a week multiple times, causing awful side effects. When I attempted to see a doctor due to having tonsillitis, I was told that it would actually be easier for me to phone 111 and go to a&e just for some antibiotics, rather than get an appointment with a practitioner. I changed to this GP when moving to Huddersfield for university in September and it has been disappointing from the start. I now feel the need to change to another service much further away so that my needs can hopefully be met.

title: Thank you!
body: Thank you to the female nurse that did my smear test today, having avoided them for nine years due to a previous bad experience she understood, put me at ease and talked me through the entire pain free procedure- a life saver quite literally!

title: No Duty of Care at this Surgery
body: I spoke to a receptionist at 3.30pm today and told her of my mother's  illness.  We thought she may have a chest infection and wanted to speak to a doctor to see if she needed antibiotics (having no surgery at the weekend, we were very anxious that she should have them ASAP).  Still no call at 5.45pm so I called again only for an automated voice to say phone lines were busy but we'll take your call as soon as we can.  15 mins later and no answer.  I phoned back at 6.02pm to see if the "out of hours" message was on - no.  An early Friday night for this surgery then.  Thanks for your (not) duty of care.  You should be ashamed.

title: Prompt assistance
body: I had a medical problem the day before a cruise with no time for an e consult. I was able to have a chat with a nurse practitioner and then able to pick up a prescription 2 hours later. Thank you so much all the staff involved.

title: Consistently fantastic and compassionate
body: We have been with this practice for over 20 years and feel extremely fortunate! Even through Covid, the Practice stayed open (unlike some others) and services were accessible and superb. The staff REALLY care, understand how anxious patients can be, and work to alleviate that as much as possible. Thank you all!

title: Great Practice
body: Today and every day throughout the Pandemic this surgery has been available  when you need it. You may have to wait to get through on the phone in the morning but after that all staff do there best to help you. Thank you all

title: Poor service
body:
If an appointment is needed you have to spend the best part of an hour trying to get through to the receptionist to request an appointment. If you are lucky you will be offered a telephone appointment which you have to wait around for all day. Not ideal if you are working 
You are unable to book any appointments in advance to discuss on going issues. 
Prior to covid you could at least book online for regular appointments.

title: Completely useless
body: Called my GP for an appointment at 8am they told me they had no appointments, to call 111, I called at 8:36 received a call back at 18:30, 10 hours later! Absolutely unacceptable! This is where the taxpayers money is going and it is shameful! You are abandoning your patients, complete disregard.

title: New patient - fantastic experience
body:
I’ve just moved to this surgery after relocating.

They arranged my repeat prescription promptly and without issue. They quickly granted me online access. Primary care is under immense pressure as most know, however in comparison to my previous surgery, this practice isn’t too bad to get in touch with. They also engage with you via the NHS app and text message.

I was seen for a new patient check with a friendly and skilled HCA who ensured my records were correct.

I also had a telephone consultation with a GP. I missed their first call by accident but they soon called back. They were very professional, knowledgeable and caring, and reached a sensible plan with shared decision making. A specialty referral and scan request was made on the same day.

The administrators are also kind and efficient.

title: Bad service
body: Had no medication as I forgot to order repeat for the first time, one of the conditions of my Illness is memory fog. I have been spoken to very rudely by more than one receptionist trying to get my daily medication which I have already missed one day. Told call back later. Still sitting in DR tray waiting to be done . Now I have to get emergency medication from chemist for the weekend. This surgery has gone down hill and sorry Covid is not a good excuse for bad manners rudeness and lack of care. I have been at this surgery longer than any of the staff and Drs. Trying to get through to them on the phone is a joke and then you get cut off after waiting in a very long queue

title: Good practice
body: Excellent doctor took time with me explained everything very clear would hope to see this doctor if needed in future

title: Outstanding service, well done all?
body:
Had to take my Wife to this Hospital after a fall!
And whar a refeshing positive experience it was.
Even though they shut doors at 18.30 and we didn't arive untill 18.10 the sevice by all Staff  I met was OUTSTANDINGLY Good.
Having dropped  my wife at the door and after parking our car I then went in to be with my wife until she got checked in. Door security was great, friendly and  polite, a very kind and informative man well suited to his job.
Reception where all ready dealing with my wife, I was even asked by the receptionists some details and was informed that I could stay with my, as I knew it would be.
But it was the way she told and the level of professionalism and kindness. Also shown by all the staff we came in to contact with, saying  they where amazing was not enough
I know the NHS is still under massive pressure but I believe even in these hard time to see such care kindness by all Staff, I just had to say something.

So Job well done to all at Grantham District Hospital, you should be so round of yourselves. 

Thankyou so much.

Bob and Margaret  Bowen.

title: Good medically but bad organisation
body: The BMEC website does not identify the medical staff working there or give any contact info for the doctors or consultants or other relevant staff or provide any medical information, so it's impossible to contact the correct people with any concerns or to follow up with questions after an appointment, or to find out much at all.  In consequence, you end up talking to the PALS or Complaints departments who can't answer any medical questions as they have no medical knowledge, and you can get stuck in a telephone queue or cut off when you do get through on the phone.  The contrast between the lack of information on the BMEC website and the wealth of helpful information on the Moorfields Eye Hospital website is stark.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent hospital
body: I had a consultation at Beardwood hospital today i must say from seeing the specialist everything was exceptional.from X-rays to having admission explained after care all i can say you all are exceptional in the care you give

title: Disgusting
body: After being on hold on the phone for an hour and a half and only moving from number 12 to 3 in the queue, I finally gave up after realising the surgery was now closed. How can they leave people queueing on the phone after they have gone home? Even worse is that it is the second time I’m reporting a patient of theirs fraudulently using my address.

title: Lovely consultant
body: A number of us patients were seen by the same medical consultant in the A&E on 23rd June 2022 in the area next to the UCC. ? subacute. We were bowled over by the excellent care and compassion of the medical consultant and her doctors who were so thorough, kind and professional. It was quite chaotic but the consultant went out of her way to help us all , explain things to us and we were saying it was better than private healthcare - except we all had to wait so long to go to the ward.

title: Didn’t phone
body: I was told I would be called by 630pm the following evening .. I wasn’t .. no answer to telephone .. no email address .. no e consult available. V bad service

title: Great practice
body: On the 5th June I arrived by ambulance to the a&e department with chest pains. Everyone from the paramedics, nurses and doctors were all very caring and professional trying to calm me and my husband and daughter. I can’t thank them all enough amazing people!

title: Great treatment
body: My experience was of the upmost professionalism from the Triage to the Trauma Nurse and Doctor. Everything was explained in great detail by the Doctor. The nurse was there reassuring me all of the time. I have nothing but high praise for the whole department.

title: Caring & Efficient Practice
body:
In 7 years of using this practice the service and care  received has always been 100% 
You are listened too and all diagnosis is done sympatheticly and efficiently. They really do care and want to offer the best care and trestment plan possible. From the receptionists to nurses to the Doctors. Every time I have felt assured by their kindness, expertise and professionalism. We are very lucky to have such a practice and are very grateful for the important service they provide

title: Good visit
body: I wanted to express my thanks for the kind treatment I received today at the practice. I attended for a blood test 3.20 on 24 June 2022 - done with care and kindness (and I didn't feel a thing, though couldn't look). Also the receptionist that looked after me following the blood test was kind and helpful in making and appointment. Everything about my visit was good; I felt 'looked after'.

title: Front of house nurses
body: Front of house needs manners all they want to do us argue and be rude last blood test shocking I  needle phobic,  and had bloods taken leaving me with blood running down my arm when leaving and a nasty bruise the nurse seemed to be rushing resulting in one test not being sent to lab

title: The System works well
body: Once I understood the system, it was great. I have had three urgent health issues this year and Maltings were absolutely brilliant. You have to follow the steps and you get results. 1. Call and wait in queue 2. Arrange callback with the team 3. Callback fm GP comes a few hours later. 4. Urgent prescription or referral is issued promptly. They are hugely helpful and it really works if you follow the steps.

title: Caring and considerate
body:
I am now in that position where my parents are coming to the end of their life . I cannot praise this practice enough for continual support and care they provide for me and my family .
They are approachable caring and responsive to our concerns and worry’s. I find the portal for contact easy to access and use and genuinely have never felt let down or disappointed by their ongoing care.

title: Appointments
body: Don’t bother trying to contact this surgery by phone as it is a COMPLETE waste of time! The last time I phoned I was on hold for over an hour and the time before that I was Number 1 in the queue for a whole hour! Basically, it’s quicker to travel there in person -if you can- to book an appointment since the busy? receptionists have better things to do? All the best doctors have retired and it seems to have gone to the dogs. When the radio says to contact? your NHS who are here to help? they obviously didn’t factor in this useless surgery!!!

title: It was great service
body:
I went to A&E on the 23 /06/2022

That evening I saw a doctor who was very  compassionate  How I was filling 
I had to have some tests X-ray blood test  

Yes it did take many hours to wait for the results to come back 
And we all had to wait our turn to be seen
The doctors and nurse were very busy 
But after long hours of waiting the doctor  reassured me 
And was very kind 
And the nurses were as well 
So before we moan about the waiting to be seen 
Just thank your selfs lucky that we have people to care for us 
We are not the only ones to be seen 
So a big big thank you to all the doctors and nurse for helping me 
To any one visiting this hospital be kind to staff and take a good book

title: Disappointed
body: I visited the practice today after receiving a letter from my gp stating can you call the practice to discuss your test results. I have been calling every day 8am for six weeks only to be told sorry have no more appointments. I called the practice today and told them I needed to speak to the practice manager.  Only to told she was on annual leave. I visited the practice and spoke to the receptionist. I advised her of my situation and asked if there was another option as I needed to my results. The way she spoke to me was totally unprofessional and disrespectful. I am in the process of changing the gp I will never step foot in there again…. The receptionist also told me that I will need a blood test for my liver but I still needed an appointment. This has caused me severe stress as I just want my test results. I had to call my sister for support. I am still in shock.

title: Great staff
body: I phoned 11 on Sunday 19th June with a pain in my lower right abdomen and was booked in for OOH almost straight away. I waited minutes to be seen and was sent straight to A&E. I had to stay the night in Charnwood and had surgery first thing on Monday this was to remove my appendix. I then stayed another night to recover after the surgery. Every staff member I spoke to were amazing, they all were very professional and knew how to keep me comfortable in a hard situation! I have nothing bad to say about the full experience.

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Pleasantly surprised
body: I work in general practice myself and so know how busy it is. I called at 8:40 and the phone was answered immediately by a friendly and helpful receptionist  without any waiting in a queue. I was offered a same to face to face appointment with an advanced nurse practitioner at a time to suit. The clinician was fantastic with my daughter, made her feel very comfortable, thoroughly examined her and I felt very confident in her assessment. Overall a fab service - thank you.

title: Great practice nothing is too much trouble
body: I have never had to wait long for reception to answer my call, they have always been very helpful and accommodating In giving me an appointment. The Doctors I have seen are always professional but caring also, explain everything In a language I understand. I would give a 5 star review

title: Despicable service
body: Arrived in an ambulance with my 18 month old, with symptoms of secondary drowning. It's been 7 hours, and still not seen a doctor. And they act like this is normal, how is a 7/8 hour wait with a child normal!?  The worst hospital in the country. Avoid at all costs.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Competent GP surgery.
body: The staff are always providing optimum treatment.  Staff are polite and professional.  The GPs are located on ground floor, nurses mainly first floor.  There is a lift available, which I've never used.  I'll probably have to use soon.  There probably is a bus running every 1/2 hour, to the corner of Curie Avenue.  A pharmacist is next door, Jhoots.

title: Bad to Worse
body:
Submitted a patient access request form with  ID documents a month ago. The receptionist said, the request will be processed within a day.
There was no response after few weeks, when I phoned them to enquire about the update, they said, it takes 28 days.
After 28 days, still there was no response received, when I enquired   they said, they lost the form. They wanted me to submit the form with documents again.  Again I have to wait for another 28 days. 
Irresponsible staff, who has no care about the GP patients. 
The service and the approach to the patients are very bad, I have had various other similar bad experiences, The approach of GP staff and their rude way of communication looks like they are planning and working to shut down the business. 
More than 40 minutes wait time for a phone call to attend.

title: Endocrine Surgery Linda McCartney building
body: Following my appointment, with the Endocrine Surgery team. I would like to say, It was of the highest standard possible. The care and compassion shown to me was truly impressive. I would highly recommend the department, and feel certain that anyone who is referred to them for treatment will feel the same. They are an absolute credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Genuine, hard working and dedicated staff.
body:
After arriving to paediatric A&E with a poorly little boy, I was quickly taken through to an initial assessment. The waiting room was completely full (as was the adult A&E). From checking in to being seen, the staff were utterly amazing. My son was having breathing issues and was monitored and examined thoroughly the whole time we were there. The doctors were called out to an emergency and our wait became longer however the staff made sure we were comfortable and checked in on us informing us of delays. No issue with this as the severity of my sons illness clearly paled in comparison to the emergency. We were seen by 2 wonderful drs and looked after by a just as wonderful nurse. I was very exhausted so can’t remember their names (apologies). The staff never stopped and the waiting rooms in both adult and paediatrics continued to be full all day/night. It would be easy for any of the staff to be rushed/ stressed and very stand of fish due to how busy they were but I never felt this at all. I felt my son was cared for, they genuinely had concern for him and investigated his issues thoroughly enough that they were able to identify issues and set us on the right path to him feeling better.
Thank you for all you do.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors
body:
An exasperating and difficult experience trying to arrange a telephone triage. For a routine case the receptionist eventually, against my judgement,  referred me to an urgent service.  The urgent service duly phoned and,  as I had expected,  said they could not deal with routine cases.   They were very helpful and made a mutually agreeable evening appt for a telephone consultation.  I then received another receptionist's call not only notifying me that the urgent team should not have made the appt for me but also advising that 'appointments cannot be made for the benefit of the patients!!'.  I duly cancelled my request for a telephone triage only to get a triage call on the following working day from the GP.  Not expecting this my phone was on silent.  It was fortunate that I just happened to be looking at something on my phone when the call came in otherwise it would have been missed. 
I was advised by the receptionist that I HAD to consult to my own GP on either a Mon or Thurs, neither of those dates being suitable for me. 
When I did speak to my GP she was excellent and offered to see me in person the following day, a Tues, not a date offered by the receptionist.   My GP was extremely thorough and helpful.  I have nothing but praise for her.   The receptionists are indeed quite another matter.......

title: Awful
body:
no matter how polite or respectful i am on the phone, they are always soooo rude!!! I understand their job must be really difficult, dealing with disgruntled patients all day - but as someone who suffers from severe social anxiety (which they are aware of) the callous, invasive and unsympathetic way im dealt with, is always really triggering. - I try to avoid this using the website but it’s functions are limited. - this all makes staying on top of my medication a terrifying and anxiety enducing experience in and of itself - Incredibly upsetting

when you do get to a doctor they’re usually pretty helpful 

i have no idea who’s leaving all these positive reviews… google reviews tells a different story

title: Really helpful reception staff.
body: Previsit telephone call to the reception regarding parking really helpful and reception staff very friendly.

title: Blood test
body: I had my blood taken for tests and the blood department did not call back in time and due to this we lost our results. I came to the hospital for an answer of what health issues I have but instead I have been left with more questions then answers

title: Rude, uncaring reception team with no empathy!
body: I truly dread calling my GP surgery. How is that right when they are there to care for and help our community? Every time I call I’m interrogated on how my case is a medical emergency. What on earth do you have to do to speak with a doctor these days? The last time I called I was so distressed. 12 weeks pregnant, severe vomiting and just tested positive for the dreaded covid. I was met with a stern ‘call 111 we are at capacity’. No kinds words, no soft tone. Just so unpleasant. Something has to be done about this Simpson Centre. Looking through other reviews though I don’t have much hope. Why take a job as a receptionist at a doctors surgery if you possess zero customer service or patient care skills and have no inclination to try. I think the team need to remember the public pay their wages and they are here to serve!

title: Fail everytime
body: My sick elderly mother has caught covid. An ambulance came out to her on friday eveing and they were going to take her to hospital. But was advised by a doctor on 111 that there is a covid team that will call us in 6 hours and will be able to help with meds. So it's been over 6 hours and I call 111 to find out whats happeneing. They reassure me someone wil call. Another hour goes by and I call again and say I'm not ending this call untill someone has confirmed what's hapoeneing. Then after being on hold for half hour. They finally tell me the covid team is closed weekends. So one was actually going to call Mr back at all. So my mum should have gone to hospital 8 hours ago with the ambulance. Its just disgusting how wrong 111 get it everytime. Shes been waiting for a call for 8 hours now from a service that won't actually even contact you till a weekday.

title: Bad communication
body: I have just turned 18 and went to a&e at Salford Royal with a query broken shin from an injury 8 days before. Arrived at 8.12pm was seen by triage didn’t wait too long by 1.40am I was sat back in reception waiting for my results. At 3am I asked receptionist how much longer she replied i was next to be seen. I noticed more people being called to be seen and by this time I had had nothing to eat or drink since 7pm. So I politely asked again at 4.50am how much longer she put a call through and the doctor that saw me had apparently spoke to me which he didn’t and discharged me. I am absolutely disgusted in how I’ve been treated to be sat there waiting all that time. Nobody had spoken to me or discharged me. The receptionist apologised and she told me it wasn’t broke which I was thankful to her. I don’t know anything else apart from that or what the best course of action is for whatever is wrong with my leg! Being polite and waiting gets you know where! A very dissatisfied and non the wiser patient

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Very good service
body: Had to see the GP about a on going issue and the visit was on time, friendly, helpful and very productive.

title: Outstanding service
body: So very grateful to the doctor who went the extra mile to reassure a worried mum. I was concerned my son had an extremely high temperature at 6pm on a Friday, the surgery were extremely efficient in arranging a last minute review of him and the doctor would have finished work late to do this. Can’t ask for more from a practice for my family.

title: Ok practice
body: Constant phone engaged when ringing it. Tried constantly for over an hour. Under dermatology and told can get repeated prescription from my own doctors then to discover they havnt sent any notes thro yet again to my doctors so cannot get prescription from them. Tried ringing ironstone centre to it been constantly engaged. I need my medication. it’s a joke

title: Great service
body:
I went to RBGH in June this year for elbow surgery. All the staff were very friendly and professional. I knew what was going on throughout my day with regards where I was on the timetable, ongoing procedures, checks and so forth. I knew what was happening and everybody was really nice. I spoke to the surgeon, anaesthetist, nurses and HCA's. All amazing!! 

After I awoke post surgery, I was looked after by some fantastic staff and was once again made to feel safe and welcome to get over my GA slowly and in my own time. Everything was clean and tidy and in ship shape order. 

I cant thank everybody enough for looking after me throughout my day surgery and I hope that they at least get hear this feedback to say what a great job they are doing.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Chaotic micro management
body:
I had several mobility problems and went to see my GP in Nov 2021. Was referred to MSK London. From first offered appointment in March 2022, every single problem was handled at a different dates, at a different location with extremely varying levels of competence and a complete breakdown in communication between the various departments and locations. It doesn't help if doctors can't keep proper records. They don't listen and they certainly don't like being asked questions.
Seven months on, I am told (for one complaint) "I don't know what it is, so how about a cortisone injection?". Really? In physiotherapy, isn't the usual approach "if there is no trauma, then look for bad habits"? Well, there never was any search for a change in lifestyle or (new) bad habits.
Well, at least, thanks to hours of searching on the internet, I have found a way of getting through the night relatively painlessly. So that is not thanks to your services. And I am regaining some mobility, thanks to gentle, very gentle yoga classes (which I pay for) and a chance remark from a radiologist friend abroad which put me on the right track. Yes, a bad habit crept in as a result of Covid obliging me to work exclusively from behind my desktop computer. 
As for one of the other complaints, there is been no improvement at all, despite telephone diagnosis and exercices. So perhaps the diagnosis is wrong. Perhaps it is not the gluteus medius and maximus at all, but the piriformis and the long dorsals???
But then, don't blame the physiotherapist who is forced to diagnose without being able to see the patient move or feel where and how much resistance there is in a joint.
Mind you, NONE of the persons I have met has actually bothered to look at how I move. Is that serious physiotherapy?????
It is a waste of my time, my tax money. And it must be very frustrating for more seriously minded medical staff too.
So after 7 months, I still don't know what is going wrong, why and what the best way might be to live with the pain crises. And can I avoid the problems getting worse? I have the impression that after a certain age, the NHS would rather see us inactive, discretely dying out of sight. And of course, we can't possibly remember things accurately. Well, I want my life back!
Because I had 4 problems and because these were tele-micromanaged, I have no idea to which appointments your customer satisfaction and health forms related. What I do know is that one of them has now embedded itself in my computer and pops up on the front page every time I open Google Chrome.
And, eh, how about fewer leading questions on that form. Example: "How many times this week did you need help". That is presuming there is help at hand. Perhaps you should add: "And was that help available?".

title: Helpful team of staff
body:
I visited the surgery four times this month and all the staff I met were caring, thorough and helpful.
I left each time feeling better and confident that they were sorting out my medical problems

title: An excellent practice
body: The doctors, nurses and reception staff are all very approachable and appear to do the very best for their patients.  If they are under pressure, as they must be in the present environment, you would not  be aware of this.

title: Good experience
body: Everyone was very welcoming to put you at your ease.From seeing my optician in February to having my second cataract operation 24th June,I was impressed by how everything was managed.My experience by the whole procedure was brilliant. Thank you.

title: Rude receptionist
body: As a cancer patient in remission I have found the doctors receptionist very rude and unhelpful so I am having trouble with a corn on the bottom of my foot I’ve never experienced one ever before I have done corn plasters ect was advised by the pharmacist to contact doctor to be referred to a podiatrist I have contacted GP and keep getting the same answers message as been sent  or can’t find anything to say I called keep saying call back in 2 days call back same thing not been sent call back 2 days been calling all week yesterday call back same thing so I told the receptionist I’ve been like this for a month now I am finding it very hard to walk on  and it is very painful all she said was she can send another message to the doctor call back in yes you guessed it 2 days so I told her that the surgery had gone down hill and don’t bother I went to A&E and there was a six hour waiting time I don’t think this is an A&E matter as they are more busy with real emergencies think the doctor should refer me as I’m on sick due to cancer but she tells me I have to go private when you can refer me on the nhs  not happy with your practice feel I have been  let down by you all

title: Efficient & amazing staff
body: Outstanding care & consideration throughout my stay from all staff: from nurses, doctors, auxiliary right through to the cleaners. Due to covid outbreak I was not able to have visitors but despite this all staff were so helpful & went the extra mile with care despite often being short staffed. All staff were extremely pleasant, helpful & caring & certainly made up for not having any visitors. I would highly recommended. I was on ward 6.

title: Couldn't have been easier
body:
I was able to receive at home treatment via MSI and it couldn't have been simpler, everything was explained in detail and I received all of the information through text so I could read through and refer to it as needed. 
All phone consultations were prompt and I felt safe and comfortable throughout. Thank you!

title: Helpful team of staff
body:
I visited the surgery four times this month and all the staff I met were caring, thorough and helpful.
I left each time feeling better and confident that they were sorting out my medical problems

title: Unacceptable phone wait times & website
body: I called the practice to book an appointment on the morning of 24 June. I was 14th in the queue. The call was answered after 59 minutes, and I was told there were no appointments left. This is an unacceptable wait time. I was told that I could have booked an appointment online, but the practice website clearly states that 'online appointments are disabled at this time due to covid.' The same message appeared when I logged into the Systmonline booking system. I was told the website was out of date. I looked on the practice website for an option to comment directly to the practice. The only option was to telephone (59 minute wait) or to print a leaflet form, fill in and post to the surgery. I found numerous broken links on the website. I know there has been a pandemic, but none of this is acceptable in 2022.

title: Absolutely Briiliant
body: It was evident that there was excellent team work.  The staff were professional, friendly and very caring in their approach.  The procedure was carried out as described in their pamphlet and so there were no surprises which really helped me to stay calm and relaxed.  I would highly recommend this hospital.

title: Fantastic practice
body:
All the medical team working here are extremely caring and will do anything they can to help.
I'd like to say its like an old fashioned doctors where the staff get to know you!! I've seen the same g.p every time and I'm thankful they do injections there rather than refer you to somewhere else, which you have to wait even longer.
It's great to see same same G.P unlike these big practices with many g.ps employed there.
So glad I came to this practice!!!

title: Excellent service
body: Seen within one hour of arriving.  I loved the self registration screens, so easy to use.  Very efficient and knowledge able triage nurse.  Sent to Urgent Care and the Nurse Practitioner who organised my Xray, treatment and drugs was amazing.  Kind, confident and gave me first class Treatment

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant staff
body: I went for a CT scan outside the cardiology department and the staff were amazing.  So friendly and welcoming.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: pavocm66
title: Friendly, helpful and caring staff
body: I have had to contact GP, dr mccamphill at The Family Practice, a few times for pregnancy and thyroid related issues. The reception staff are always polite and helpfull. The GP has always returned my call in a very timely manner. She is caring and very helpful. Her attitude and advice has really helped me through a difficult time.

title: Still no appt
body: 're my previous review. Tried again at 8:00 am by phone to get an appt 're swollen painful knee. Told I was 25th in queue finally spoke to receptionist at 8:30 only to be told all appt had gone. I explained I had tried the day before via phone and calling in surgery She was apologetic and said try the next day phone at 8:00 am. Why keep telling us that when there are no appts. She also said I could queue at the surgery at 8:00am and hopefully get an appt that way or could go to nx hospital to the walk in clinic. As far as I'm aware the walk in clinic at nx is not there to be used as a extension for a Drs surgery. I can appreciate Drs are under pressure but what has happened at the health centre to make such a drastic change to the way it's now run.

title: Great receptionist
body:
I just want to applaud the receptionist who dealt with my call today, she was everything I needed her to be, kind, understanding and efficient. She gave me comfort and advice about my brother and I felt listened to
Thankyou

title: Difficulty contacting
body: I visited Outpatient on 20 June and received excellent treatment.  My problem now, is I need an endoscopy and have unfortunately been given two different dates and times for this, one by phone and one by letter.  I have tried several times to contact the department but been unable to speak to anyone and have left several messages but no one has called back.  I am now getting extremely stressed as there are only a few days before my appointment and I don’t know which date is correct.  Also the booklet which I must read before attending was not enclosed so I have no idea what I should/not do before my appointment. Is it too much to ask that telephone calls are answered?

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ro63
title: GP appointments
body: Very responsive practice to online consultations.  So easy now to get GP appointments, repeat prescriptions etc

author: sophie_r
title: A health centre delivering a fantastic service.
body:
Please pass my feedback on to Dr Osen at Wick Health Centre. This man is incredible and we need more doctors like this in the UK!  
I initially went in to discuss a lump I had discovered in my breast which I was very nervous about as was unsure what to expect at my appointment. He instantly made me feel at ease with his lovely chit chat and very informative about what to expect during my examination/appointment. Any further questions I asked were answered in full detail (he is very knowledgeable!) and I never felt like my appointment was being rushed.  
Dr Osen also made me feel very comfortable during my examination and carried himself with great professionalism. He also took his time during my appointment to understand more about my personal circumstances/ mental health which I was not expecting to be discussed in the detail that Dr Osen went into. This really means a lot to me! In the past I have doctors who have shrugged off mental health conversations and not checked in on their patients well being.  
Dr Osen showed great empathy and understanding towards my emotions -. I really needed that chat today and I have left my appointment feeling like a weight has been lifted off my shoulders... along with a plan from the doctor to identify the lump'in my breast and a plan to improve my mental health.  
Thank you so much Dr Osen - keep up the hard work because we need more people like you! You are amazing at what you do!  
I would also like to make a comment to The Wick Health Centre in general because the team on reception are also wonderful and always very polite. I was seen incredibly quickly as well (which also includes the team booking appointments in for me at Homerton Hospital in super speedy time!). My previous doctors was not run to this level so its nice to see there are some good health centres out there delivering a fantastic service.  
Thank you so so much! :) Feeling very grateful for the NHS service you are providing!

readBy.name: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic staff
body: Receptionist was very helpful and the lovely doctor went out of his way to help. Can't thank them enough

title: Great Practice - Not
body: Over the last week I have been trying to make contact with the Tessa Jowell Surgery by phone and online. The phones are constantly on voicemail and the online is offline. There seems to a shortage of both receptionists and GP's. I wonder if anyone gets does actually get through? I am a 64 year old man seeking a blood test for glucose and prostrate cancer - that is my priority. They seem to want me to offer me an HIV test - have they lost their minds? Why is it they have resources for things we don't need and don't have resources for what we do need. The GP surgery and the NHS have been lost in the last 2 years and I fear this is the 'new normal'.

title: Call
body:
Receptionist booked a call back for the 25th June 2022. I percifically mentioned that my mobile phone does not allow calls to be answered from blocked numbers. Receptionist assured me this would be highlighted in the notes for today's cb. 
Dr called with withheld no. Just sums up this practice.

title: Wonderful team (Endoscopy)
body:
Just had my second surveillance Colonoscopy at Royal Berks in 3 years. I was contacted before the visit to ensure I was happy and fully understood the procedure. No hanging around when I arrived. I was made ready straight away. The staff were just so friendly and reassuring. Everyone has time for you.
Procedure was started on time and was over in 20-30 minutes. Invasive yes, but not painful. Once finished It was tea and biscuits whilst waiting for sedation to wear off.  In total less than 2 hours. Follow up calls to ensure all was okay.  The department is a credit to the Trust.

title: Friendly and knowledgeable staff
body: Whenever I have to visit the surgery the staff treat you with kindness and consideration and no request seems too much trouble for them.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Myself and my family have been patients at this practice for many years. All staff members are compassionate, caring and aim to give you the best care possible. Highly recommend this practice to everyone.

title: Wonderful Care
body:
My dad was at Red House from April to June. The care given was wonderful and a great comfort to me and my family. The staff were just exceptional, loving and caring just as you would want. For the first time in quite a while my dad felt safe and comfortable and as happy as he could have been. 
He died last weekend, I will be forever grateful that at the end he was surrounded by lovely people.
Thank you

title: No one answers calls
body: Getting to the hospital is horrible due to transport options and no one answers the phone. We’ve been calling for over 30 min as we’re running late and cannot get through to the imaging department or operator.

title: Poor practice
body: Asked for   my medication review after been admitted to hospital on Wednesday night shortness of breath and high blood pressure  earliest opportunity for me to have my medication review is 3 weeks

title: Poor office staff
body: We used Sarah Care for about a year, although we had a couple of nice carers, the mail issues were the office staff. It seemed to be an issue every week with the rotas changing, we always asked for about 9am calls in the morning but they would constantly put us down for 7am. Some of the carers left a lot earlier than they should, and when you are paying for a certain length of time it's not fair to leave early on every call especially when the jobs weren't getting done. When you have to ring the office to report these issues it was always a bad attitude you received back. I wouldn't recommend this company.

title: Lovely hospital, very clean
body:
All staff vary helpful and friendly 
Just one grip why is the friends of the hospital cafe at the very top end .
When there are two Costas nearer the entrance

title: Repeat prescription process
body:
This process needs to be reviewed urgently, reception will not request repeat prescriptions over the phone and are asked to send an email. 
I requested my medication as an urgent request, due to lack of remaining medication. I receive a call 6 days later to say this still hasn’t been issued!! All in all I will now be going 9 days without medication, which I have stated to reception. No real empathy or willing to resolve urgently.

title: Spamedica Watford
body:
I had my first operation on 20th June , for my cataract in my left eye, I received friendly professional service from all the staff that I came in contact with, my operation was painless and the result has been amazing so far.
Thank you all for a wonderful service.

title: Great practice
body: I recently registered at this practice. Everything has been smooth and efficient. The receptionist is friendly and helpful. The doctor has been proactive following up on test results which other doctors have previously ignored. I feel well looked after and safe in their hands. I am so glad I switched to this practice.

title: Wonderful Patch test staff!!
body:
Brilliant staff, funny, warm and kind. 
Always on time, very considerate and willing to chat through any concerns I had. Very clear instructions and care instructions. They even helped me to chase up my gp tests. Can't recommend them enough! 
I would be happy for my family to be seen by this fabulous team!

title: Awesome
body: Everyone from ambulance to care was lovely, couldn’t ask for a better health care, had to wait a while, I’m not special they assessed me and I was in line, witnessed everyone else care couldn’t see a problem am truly thankful & humbled to them all

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: FCP Service is brilliant
body: My GP referred me to the surgery FCP for a long term neck problem.  The service I received was brilliant - the FCP spent time to listen and understand what my problem was and organised an urgent referral for treatment which I had within a week.  I have had several follow up calls since then to discuss how I am and to review my medication.  I think the FCP service at the surgery is invaluable!

title: Professional and speedy treatment
body: We visited Wythenshawe hospital A&E early afternoon time, after our youngest son gashed his head after a fall. They were super quick at seeing him and managed to calm my husband’s and my nerves, with their professionalism and reassurance. There was a lot of activity during our wait but we received the upmost care and service. The work this staff do everyday is amazing - thank you so much. We’re very grateful and relieved to have you only a short distance from our home. Continue the great work - it’s not unnoticed.

title: Amazing practice
body: Just want to say a huge thank you to every single person in A&E, you are all so very busy. But from the moment i got to A&E i was rushed off to a bed and was reassured by all the staff that i was in the best hands. They made sure i was going to be okay from start to finish and helped me alot. Thank you so much. We are lucky to have you alll.

title: Amazing staff
body: Ward B11 - thank you to all the staff, especially one nurse who stopped out the most. From the moment i arrived she reassured me helped me and calmed me down. I am so grateful that all the nursers and doctors provided me with such quick care that i was able to go home as i liked. Thank you to the doctor who was extremely busy for coming out of her way just to make sure i was all okay to leave the ward and went above and beyond to try cure my sickness. Thank you so much. You are all a credit to this country

title: Polite and Professional
body: From my first visit for an assessment to the  day of my operation I was put at ease and dealt with in a courteous ,friendly and professional manner.I would recommend anyone thinking of using SpaMedica not to hesitate. 5 stars for me.

title: Very friendly and professional
body: All staff that I have seen at Watford General are very helpful and professional, especially the people at the AAU team. Me and my wife stayed for a night and were treated wonderfully

title: Lovely staff
body: I came in for a blood test. The nurse was very friendly and put me at ease. It was all over quickly and painlessly.

title: The best customer service
body:
This was the BEST customer service and experience i have had ever. The staff were working hard with a busy queue of people but were lovely, polite and really helpful.
I needed further help so needed to wait but was informed what was happening and the other members of the public were treating with as much care and attention.
I have never written a review before but really feel strongly the experience was as it should be and the staff were working under pressure but managed to get the perfect balance of efficiency and customer service.
Thank you!

title: Most amazing service
body: I have recently accessed BPAS Liverpools services and I am amazed by the kindness and compassion shown by the staff. Everything was taken care of with efficiency and professionalism. The midwives made me feel so safe and reassured and non judged. It’s a scary time being a young girl making such a big decision and the staff showed support and care every step of the way ensuring I had all the information I needed. I am so grateful that we have access to these types of services providing women with choice and empowering them. The whole journey I have not felt judged or pressured into or out of a decision. I can’t thank the amazing staff enough for everything they have done for me the last 2 weeks I am so grateful.

title: Good service
body: Lots of text reminders, limited waiting, staff friendly …easy to find, ample car parking, … all very good, positive experience.

title: Outstanding care
body:
My baby and I receive care and support from Warrengate Medical centre that is outstanding. Our GP goes above and beyond to help, demonstrates huge empathy and an overall honest and trustworthy approach to giving medical help, advice and support (adult and baby) and the rest of the staff are very kind, supportive and helpful. The building is lovely and appointment availability is fantastic whether it be via online services on their website, telephone or face to face. 

They are quick and effective when it comes to initial registration too. 

At Warrengate I have received the best medical care compared to all other medical establishments we have ever visited. I cannot fault the practice one bit and actually feel lucky that my family are on their patient list.

title: Couldn’t fault
body: I was under the care of urology and had an operation on Friday, I was primarily cared for by the Day Care Unit on the day. I can’t fault any of the staff from both departments, every member of the team was so caring and thorough within their practice. The nursing staff exceeded any expectation I had and put my mind at ease from the procedure I was having done as a 25 year old man. I just wanted to say a huge thank you to all the staff, you made this horrible day as comfortable and welcoming as possible.

title: Great service at Day surgery unit
body: Attending for a biopsy the treatment was first class, the ward was well staffed and I was kept informed, on going have the procedure done the surgeon and other staff were great, everything was explained to me what would happen and really it was pain free which was quite a surprise to me, I would like to thank the staff involved, after the procedure I was returned to the ward where I was offered tea or coffee and a sandwich or biscuits all really helpful staff, everyone was great and I heartily thank them all, fantastic treatment.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Received wonderful care.
body:
Attended ENT Dept. to have some lumps in neck investigated. Within 2 hours I had seen consultant, had ultrasound scan, had two fine needle biopsies, bloods taken and CT scan arranged.
Cannot speak highly enough of all of the staff I saw that day!
